SEARCH
Module AM08
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.GameBoard
public final class GameBoard extends Object
This is the class used for the simulation of the physical game board. It can do all the features required for the correct advancement of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(GameBoard gameBoard, List<Integer> cg)
      Copy constructor of the game board.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - gameBoard to be copied
      cg - list of common goals to be copied

  • Method Details

    • createGameBoard

      public static GameBoard createGameBoard(int numPlayers, List<Integer> cg)
      This method is the utility used by the GameModel to get the gameBoard based on the number of players
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - number of players of the current game (between 2 and 4)
      cg - list of integers representing the common goals for the current game
      Returns:
      game board configured and filled

    • fillBoard

      public void fillBoard() throws NoMoreTilesAtStartFillBoardException, NoMoreTilesToFillBoardException
      The method fills the board up until it is possible. It fills just the positions which are empty, so it avoids to overwrite the remaining tiles on the board. If at the start of the method the bag is empty, then it throws an exception that needs to be checked If at some moment after it started filling it finds out that the bag is empty, then also needs to throw an exception (different) that can be checked maybe to avoid calling the function again
      Throws:
      NoMoreTilesAtStartFillBoardException - self-explanatory
      NoMoreTilesToFillBoardException - self-explanatory

    • hasToBeFilled

      public boolean hasToBeFilled()
      This method checks if the board has to be filled. In detail for each tile in the board(not invalid and not empty) you look if it has any neighbors not empty. If no tile satisfies the condition then it means there are only lonely "islands" on the board, and it should be filled again by calling fillBoard()
      Returns:
      true if the board has to be filled

    • positionOccupied

      public boolean positionOccupied(Position p)
      This method is useful to the GameModel to check if the user did input a correct move, checking if it is not in a not empty or invalid tile
      Parameters:
      p - coordinates of the tile
      Returns:
      true if the position is effectively occupied by some valid tile

    • hasFreeAdjacent

      public boolean hasFreeAdjacent(Position p)
      This method checks if a tile has at least one free adjacent space, useful to the GameModel to check also that it is a valid move
      Parameters:
      p - coordinates of the tile
      Returns:
      true if the tile in position p has at least one empty space in one of the final directions

    • getCommonGoal

      public CommonGoal getCommonGoal(int idx)
      Getter of the common goal at a specified index
      Parameters:
      idx - index of the common goal
      Returns:
      common goal at the index specified as parameter

    • removeTile

      public Tile removeTile(Position p)
      This method is useful to the GameModel when the player makes a move, it removes a tile from the current board (sets it to empty) and returns it
      Parameters:
      p - position of the move that needs to be done (assumed correct, since all the controls are done before)
      Returns:
      the tile contained in position p

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Method that checks the equality between two game board objects
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - object to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the game board are the same (same tiles and same common goals)

    • getGameBoardCopy

      public Tile[][] getGameBoardCopy()
      This method returns a copy of the current game board, useful for passing information to the client
      Returns:
      a copy of the game board

    • getPointStacksCopy

      public List<Integer> getPointStacksCopy()
      This method creates a copy of all the point stacks present in the current game
      Returns:
      a list of all the stacks (represented also by lists)

    • pop

      public Integer pop(Integer idx)
      This method pops the value from the stack at the index in input
      Parameters:
      idx - index of which stack to be popped
      Returns:
      popped value
